intro: Gyrocarpus americanus var. pavonii, commonly known as the pavonii variant of the American gyrocarpus, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Hippocastanaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive fruit structure. The plant produces a unique, woody, spiky fruit that contains a single seed, typical of the genus Gyrocarpus. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. The botanical features of this variant make it an important species for ecological studies and potential medicinal research.
